title: CVE-2017-12985: The IPv6 parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in ip6_print()
content:
Reported to the devs on 4 February 2017.
Tcpdump 4.9.2 released on 8 September 2017.
Patch: https://github.com/the-tcpdump-group/tcpdump/commit/66df248b49095c261138b5a5e34d341a6bf9ac7f
The IPv6 parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-ip6.c.

steps: Run tcpdump version before 4.9.2 with the command: ./tcpdump -nr test003
Observe the heap-buffer-overflow error in the ip6_print function when parsing IPv6 packets
vuln_description: The IPv6 parser in tcpdump before version 4.9.2 contains a buffer over-read vulnerability in the ip6_print function (print-ip6.c). This allows an attacker to read beyond the allocated memory bounds when processing specially crafted IPv6 packets, potentially leading to information disclosure or a crash.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to trigger with a crafted packet and requires no complex interactions between components. The issue is localized to a single function (ip6_print) and follows a common pattern of buffer over-read vulnerabilities in parsers.
